rWctX6GUQ9nyJHtX_cR10g.text: Really lovely little venue - small but tasty selection of alcoholic drinks - the vibe is chilled - well it was when we visited on a Sunday. Funky decor, nice tunes. It's kinda got it all actually. We were hungy and the staff said we could buy a takeaway and bring it back to eat if we liked - really nice touch. Have been recommending to friends. The cat has amazing eyes

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.text: hmm just to concur with the above really! Shame it doesn't do food, but yes it feels like home from home, very relaxed, friendly and looks nicely worn in.  The cats are a nice touch too :-)

HEXB5XbbKOFYnnl9a8JOxQ.text: I love this bar. I came here a few years back and didn't feel very welcome,but boy has it changed! It sells all the good drinks now including cream soda! They also have a great old school Hollywood movie thing going on in the new basement and loads of vintage car stuff everywhere. It all goes well with an unusual mix of old school Blues, hip hop, classical and even some very old country music! Anyone would love it here. It somehow makes me want to go to the deep south and do something exciting.My best part? The staff and they're lack of exclusivity. Oh, and the coffee is better then ever. They use English roasters to keep is local .And the basement cinema is rare.And the European mix.And the staff are rare.love it.

qvoJbJtaARtaIELcUWOChw.text: hooray, a coffee shop that also sells beer and wine - so obvious yet so hard to find in the UK, why is that? plentiful intellectual reading matter (and I mean seriously intellectual - I've never seen the journal Foreign Policy in a cafe before) on hand for posing too - perfect!

f9HMH4FwY20kpizVXNGfOw.text: Vespa's reputation is well deserved. This is a great little hide-away. I took my friends here and they called it rejuvinating and described the hot chocolate as the best that they had ever had. This has quickly become my favourite local establishment.

PySvRrSkYBLEzVSDC9Xw8A.text: I went here for the VHS Movie Club, run by a friend of my other half. Though we spent an extra ten minutes walking around in the freezing cold, getting confused as to where it was, it's unique charm and inviting atmosphere cheered us up almost immediately.Quite apart from how excited we were to sit around in a student-esque basement cafe and watch VHS movies, the girls behind the bar were lovely and two beers for £6 isn't to be sniffed at. Especially when they're so tasty.I could overlook the slightly strange bathroom downstairs (just, go look, I cant explain it) - and the death-trap stairs - for the sake of a fun night out in a quirky and well-loved little bar. Definitely a great night time hang out, though I'd be happy to take my laptop back and work there for the afternoon as well.

CDwcTKb3yepTfrh0aXk17Q.text: Oh my god! this place really is amazing! It's got a really relaxed vibe, with a cat strolling about, chilled tunes on the stereo, and the most amazing hot chocolate I have ever tasted in my life... seriously! this stuff is like chocolate mouse! £1.80 a cup! such a treat! They dont serve food here but you are welcome to bring in your own lunch and eat it there which is great!They have lots of scooter helmets on the wall and a vespa inside! try it you will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

6EHk5o_ypbjya5TW-pOIEw.text: Funky little space, very welcoming and friendly. And they have a wi-fi hot spot! Hot diggity! Lots of different drinks on offer, and the decor is interesting, especially if you're into scooters. Quite a mixed crowd, mainly young people, many with laptops. Enjoy!

FY2HjpJyNNl51iegcR7CAw.text: The best hot chocolate I have ever had in London. So creamy and thick. Even now thinking about it I want to go back and I will. The atmosphere is so relaxing, with a vintage feeling and it also has a small garden. Perfect for a chat with your friend.

z7XltPpS4kR-9-q3WBphvQ.text: Cool vibe.  Now called "Vespa", this dimly lit cafe has two floors with small tables and serves a deliciously thick hot chocolate imported from italy.  Once it gets cooler, the hot chocolate sort of has the consistency of a pot de creme.  I love that it's not too sweet and has a good chocolate flavor, but isn't so rich that you can only drink a few sips.The best part?  They have board games such as Scrabble and Monopoly (an old school British version)!  Great place to pass a rainy afternoon.

gJqWt4-DLF-8mF5aGRnXBQ.text: Trendy experience but overpriced fare for my taste! And coffee is all very well, but have a little more food :-( Like the cats though.

o9Gob2No4clnHsFiN4jZrg.text: Interesting place with interesting people. Good service and really interesting atmosphere. Felt strage the first time I went there, but I liked it.

gTPXGB6DERlMX7crHAMU7g.text: Entering into this place felt a little bit like a warp in space and time.I had no idea this place was highly rated before coming here, and so with no pre-conceptions over it, proceeded to order a flat white that was quite possibly one of the best coffees I've ever had.Unlike the smallness of some coffee places, it didn't bother me so much - people seemed friendly, and I had a cat to look at.Unfortunately as mentioned below, they're limited in what food they do - but they allow you to bring food from elsewhere. Quick visit to Greensmiths made this visit a little slice of perfection for our late lunch/dinner between classes.I've been here a few times since, and the coffee and staff/customer friendliness has remained consistent each visit. A new little favourite of mine and highly recommended!

n9jCZi7wZkYYb2IFxU4Rzg.text: While mods and scooterists make me grumble and swear under my breath, the ScooterCaffe is mercifully free from idiots with Paul Weller haircuts and unhealthy obsessions with tailoring. No, the kicker with this great little haunt is that it's a rickety shambles of a place that seemingly has some kind of tractor beam installed in it, meaning that, should you pop in for a hot drink, there's a very good chance you'll never ever leave. It's a cosy place alright with a friendly mix of people all loafing around and trying to attract the attentions of the most aloof cats I've ever met. Yep. This cafe has cats mooching about the place ignoring absolutely everyone in there and, of course, if you're a cat person like me, this makes them even more irresistible and you split your time evenly between grinning to yourself, admiring the clutter that adorns the walls and wishing the felines would make friends with you for just one second. If you want something a bit stronger than the hot drinks, they sell beers and spirits as well, which makes this one of the best places I visited in London. It's a pretty unassuming place, but it is well worth popping in. Just don't tell too many people. You'll want to keep this all for yourself.

57BnAk_LOPO01bd0wyfozw.text: Love love love this place! it's a gem really! I stumbled apon it one day while walking through lower marsh! and how glad I was to come across it!It's got a really relaxed vibe, with a cat strolling about, chilled tunes on the stereo, and the most amazing hot chocolate I have ever tasted in my life... seriously! this stuff is like chocolate mouse! £1.80 a cup! such a treat!They dont serve food here but you are welcome to bring in your own lunch and eat it there which is great!They have lots of scooter helmets on the wall and a vespa inside!try it you will love it!

L5Xx6keTqPS4t_Glfw4Q7g.text: A wonderful little hideout in the hotchpotch that is Lower Marsh, Scootercaffe (formerly Scooterworks - they don't do repairs any more, just coffee) is a right good place with plenty of atmos and the most awesome Spanish-style hot chocolate you'll find this side of, er, Spain. It's full of transport related objects and generally old artefacts; there are also at least three cats hiding in and around the place. I love it here. However, there are a couple of bad bits standing in the way of the big five. For all the quirks and old stuff, what also comes with that is a little bit of grime and only two comfy chairs. But, you know, it's the kind of thing you sacrifice when you choose the scruffy, atmospheric, beautiful independent over the harsh lighting and pleather sofas of St*rbucks.

oIPX-WRGzwRpTFHEH-W5RQ.text: I've searched Lower Marsh at least 3 times for Scooter Café, but was unable to find it at its listed address. Does it have a hidden entrance?

DrG24S3gAGYnDOJHiadseA.text: Quirky, vibey place that attracts a super-chilled bunch - for good reason. This little shop serves good coffee and wonderful chocolate cake in a small area. To get to the toilets you sashay down a tight little circular staircase and a kitty roams about. On a good weather day you could sit out on the tiny terrace out back - but inside is just great. They have Vespa and scooter goodies all over the place (their original raison d'etre) and great reading material scattered about. When you're finished with the reading material and people watching watch the barista and you'll be amazed at how she/he prepares everything in a tiny ships galley like space! Pure theatre, I think. In the lovely Lower Marsh area this is certainly one to try. Finally - they serve beers alongside their other hot drinks - which is a bonus for some.

FeGXI1cPpJXBaDoQvtD-Hg.text: This cafe is utterly unique and there's so much to love about it. The coffee is great, the staff are friendly and attractive, the cake is (generally) good, the cats are willing to be stroked and happy to relieve you of your lunch and you can bring in lunch bought from elsewhere (as long as you take away your rubbish). It basically feels like a sanctuary from everything that isn't awesome in the world - especially the basement. There's a couple of things I'd change - the chairs, the distinctly average brownies they sell and how much they charge for them - but this is really nitpicking. I'm just dreading the day that this place gets so popular I can't get a seat - feels like it might have already happened on some days.

6OQdO-qZyAow03l49rLaYw.text: Tis my absolute favourite bar ever. I love the ambiance and the cats. It always seems quite full, but generally, if patient, someone is either willing to share a table, or something will open up. The Monday night films are great, and the staff are pleasant and kind. Once they ran out of red wine, so the bloke sent someone to the shop to get a bottle, just for me. Lovely decor, you are allowed to bring in outside food and very cool downstairs area. No matter what, I always end up here!

135xdwfyENRn58wi1nYNmw.text: **I would like to add that they have just had a refurb of there basement area [which was previously not in use] and are having film nights on mondays... on a HD projector and large screen.... and FREE Saw Blade Runner there, i hear they had/were [ i was tweeking on caffeine to pay too much attention to the conversation] having a scooter-themed season and to expect fellini and uh... other stuff.** They have some kind of 1950s Faema coffee machine for those coffee aficionados out there. I believe they started as a scooter outlet which served their customers coffee.... Which explains all the scooters / scooter parts strewn about the place, and spark plugs behind the counter. They also hold a monthly experimental music night which sounds quite exciting.

XLv0VtB21O0dSGv4k0ihYQ.text: Nestled on Lower Marsh with a mysterious bar sign glowing red, you'll find a spectacular place. Home away from home, its like being in someone's vintage living room. Do pop in for a coffee or libation of some sort. I give it Three thumbs up!

B_wKxmu2Z2IL5FG5fc-efQ.text: Absolutely my favourite coffee shop in the world. When it first opened and was more of Scooter repair place than a coffee shop i used to walk past and think, that looks cool but was too chicken to go in. Then chairs started to appear and people were more visibly sitting and talking with drinks inside. The coffee is absolutely the best in the area. The atmosphere is super chilled, like walking in to 1967 complete with mismatched furniture, games in the corner and cats wandering about. The new downstairs is a great addition as it was beginning to become difficult to get a seat in there! I remember when the downstairs was still in progress though and i had to go to the loo once in a place with no walls! Absolutely hilarious. I've been here for meetings in the day and on dates and with friends in the evenings. The wine is nice and well priced, two bottle beers available Corona and Morretti. Oh and there used to be some insanely beautiful twins who worked there. Tall and willowy and just beautiful. The staff are always dead friendly though, twins or no twins.

HxTep0cfnF6HKs3CcJrGGA.text: There is a shop on Lower Marsh street, which is down the side of Waterloo station in between Waterloo Road and Westminster Bridge Road, called Scooterworks. It, not very surprisingly, sells and repairs old scooters, Vespas and the like, which are all really cool. What is even cooler though is that at the back of the shop, nestled between the scooters is a totally unique coffee shop. You'll have never seen anything like it. Also there is a great little courtyard out the back which would be a fab on a hot summer's day.

dazpvTuAFLAnaoa0wXvtaw.text: Yet another not-so-secret-anymore cafe/bar at an area that's not teeming with tourists or travelers. Probably best for quiet times in the afternoon, as it tends to get busier during after work hours. A great place to lounge in whilst reading a book or writing that novel, or for more intimate secret rendezvous meetings. Great vintage decor, so it's a 'cool' hideout to take a non-Londoner to.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

2Dz7oQBt_T1VLAbDqfT9yA.text: This is a very quirky place in a very quirky street. It one of these pretty unique little Coffee Shop with a charm all of it's own. It's actually a bar as well, welcoming friendly and cosy, especially on a cold rainy day. Coffees good but don't ask for a flat white here. They do food like cakes and snacks here which look good but didn't have a chance to try out. BTW the Coffee (Latte) was £2.30 quite good value for the area. Anouk and Charlotte who will probably be serving you are adorable, and charming enough to secure this place a well deserved 5* review.

3uU5WU7mP9z3Myanwn9JJw.text: I really love this place! Ahassle-free cafe/bar is on a quiet side street. Its interior includes somevintage scooter placed near the window, a table that seems like old sewingequipment, a small garden, a layer of board games a black and white cat. Must highly recommended!

Bg-e3UX1XxyzRxnq4J22CA.text: This bar has great individuality, drinks (including soft drinks!) and staff, so basically is a winner on all fronts. Other Yelp reviewers have pretty much said it all already - retro, low key, cosy, charming. It's a great place to go for a quiet relaxed drink and generally just have a darn good time. Maybe I just don't get out enough but I haven't found many other bars in London this good.

6BoC0rS6S217JJsW72b0uA.text: Wow, are you sure - 5 stars?! Erm yep, no doubt about it. This place has so much character and charm it really didn't matter that the loo didn't actually have a sink, I mean at least it had a loo!So this place was on the agenda for Larissa and mines coffee morning today and popping in was a treat. they didn't do filter coffee but what they did do, they did well. They also now seem to be stocking tasty looking chocolate brownies too! A mish mash of cute tables and chairs and super friendly service you can't really ask for more. A great little coffee shop that also holds its own as a bar.

_yYZtLcN_JmDt6oz6eseIQ.text: What a cute cafe. The coffee was the best that we have had in London so far! Great atmosphere and friendly staff.

2mL757uZQ1jBEIVpYebpuQ.text: I love Scooter Caffe! I go by Waterloo station all the time and didn't know this existed until a few weeks ago. There are allegedly two cats here but I've only ever seen one. He likes to sleep in the buggy right next to the front door. Nice place to stop in for a flat white or mid-day beer. If you want to feel especially hip, go to the Waterloo vaults and check out whatever exhibit is currently on, ogle at some graffiti art, then go here and sit in the terrace out back. They also let you bring in outside food (all they have is a couple of pastries).

s8Z7CbKmzaV7dfQdoy4i2g.text: This place is located in one of the seediest neighbourhoods I have been to, but it's a 5 min walk from Waterloo. So that's pretty cool.My main reason to go there was board games, but all we could find was the oldest possible box of Scrabble I have ever seen. However, we had ipads, and we sat there playing scrabble for hours. So yay.There was no beer on tap and that always disappoints. But they stock Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, and that compensates for the lack of tap and everything else. Hurray!My friends wanted Frappuccino, but they didn't have any cold stuff. (except beers). She ended up having the greatest hot chocolate ever!!!I think my neck touched the curtains, and that gave me a rash! But then, I am just hypersensitive.YES, I loved this place. Every time I visit London, ScooterCaffe is going to be on the top of the things to do list.

DuZouMxE17odOJrWzBGtnw.text: 5 star rating17/1/2010 3 photosWoefully under-advertised and sadly not open on Sundays the Scooter Cafe serves coffee, tea, hot chocolate and alcoholic beverages in a venue that gradually morphed from a Scooter repair workshop into a pub/cafe (you can still find tools scattered about and there is a scooter in the front window, often inhabited by one or both of their two pet cats). You can bring your own food. They show free films downstairs on Monday nights and have a supply of board games. Downstairs is also available to hire for private parties. The prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is unlike anywhere else, a real vintage gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. current shop front

EKLn57o4zEycm6b-OS_I6Q.text: I am firmly on board with this place! The coffee is amazing...so much that I had two lattes at 8 PM at night. Completely unpretentious, it was a great venue for a first date. As long as it's a low-key first date. People watching was fabulous, the staff were super friendly to everyone, including a homeless man who came in for a tea and kept talking to them during busy spells.The only thing is, I was a bit worried about the surrounding area, considering we left at about 10 PM but turned out to be fine. Will be returning to partake in some board game action!

_5Pq_EAdLMFnKdTE6F9IeQ.text: A tear came to my eye when I walked in.  I could have spent all day at Scooter Cafe because the atmosphere just sucks you in.  Funky, cozy, odd, happy greatness is the best way to describe it.  And the little back deck on a nice day is nothing short of heaven.Coffee was not that notable, but who cares when you are so happy in the surroundings.  Want to quit my job and hang out with my laptop there all day long.

_lJJ2GDoZXodtc1gt7pR0g.text: Totally unique and a delight to go to, the Vespa Caffe cheers me up to no end because personality is allowed here and there is no bland nod to perceived commercial wisdom/tat!! Came here yesterday morning with 2 friends for a quick catch up. Caffe was already busy with young mums and dads and their buggies. We managed to squeeze ourselves into a corner and it was well worth it. Awesome coffees from the Faema professional barista machine (rare to find in the UK). Cat lovers will adore their experience here where a moggy roams free amongst the customers!! Curiously, little to no food on offer apart from biscoti. I was advised by the friendly waitress to nip out to near by shops to get pastries which I did from Greggs and Green(??? can't remember the rest of the name) down the road. Hey, may be someone (me, even!) should offer to make snacks for them to sell in the caffe!!! Cup cakes come to mind :o) I cannot wait to go back there for drinks in the evening. Such a terrific place to hang out at and it is independent too!

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

fM2SfVmbqrtsxKHnlzr4TQ.text: If you pop in here within the next week and find I've moved in, don't be surprised. Buy me a coffee instead. I came here for an event last week and it's... perfect. I wanted to come back during the day to get a proper idea of it, and I have and I love it here. Really, there's nothing about this cafe/bar/music venue/events thing/ cinema thing of brilliance that I don't like. Here are some things that are awesome: The latte. Perfect. Not so much coffee I'm a jittery wreck, and lots of foam.The music. Old school indie. Perfect.The decor - scooters! Everywhere! How silly! There used to be a scooterworkshop here, now there's not but it's still fun!Cats! Anywhere can be vastly improved with the addition of a purry kitty. Well this place has four, I think. The tips go to the food fund. CutenessThe events. Live mic nights, SATURDAY MORNING CARTOONS and other things of awesome.You can take your own lunch in. They ask you to take your rubbish though. Nice.Free wifi! Yay! See? Moving in.Cute boys! Very cute boys. Everywhere. Staff, punters, scooter cat loving boys. See? There's nothing I don't like about this place. The fact that I only live fifteen minutes away makes me very very happy. I've spent my time in London searching for the perfect cafe. I think I've found it.

hMjedLvnFgO_5Fhc15mbyA.text: Scooterworks is a comfort vortex.  If I didn't have places to go I would lounge in here for eternity.  There is a store cat that hangs out with the customers and lounges on the chairs.  I covet its destiny.  I would love to lay all over this place all day and get petted without having to worry about diurnal responsibilities.  What a great life.And what a great place.  The décor is all funky, with a motor engine espresso machine and old-school Vespa signs posted on the wall.  They have board games and super comfy chairs.  Most of the people having coffee here looked like regulars.  A lot of people were writing and reading and chatting with the staff.  It is a really relaxed atmosphere.  This is definitely a hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

E0_Gl6aojWdhyT-WO0fN4Q.text: I love this place. This cosy unassuming cafe/bar is on a quiet side street near Waterloo station. Its decor includes the eponymous scooter in the window, a table that looks like a piece of old sewing equipment, a shelf of board games, a small rear garden and (best of all) a black and white cat. It's a great place to relax during the afternoon over a drink and have a chat with a friend or for a more intimate drinking hole in the evening. There's not a lot of selection for beers and wines but they have a lot of hard liquor. The beer and wine isn't badly priced. It's also great for a coffee or tea. The atmosphere just makes me feel relaxed and content.

Kr221bEAt8StEV6teORYrQ.text: The Scooter Works bar and cafe, just behind Waterloo station is my newest discovery. It is an absolute delight. I was taken by a friend of mine who has been coming here for 4 years, and is always happy when she misses her train at Waterloo because it means that she can come here instead. The idea behind this small little room is that is emulates a 50's Italian coffee shop where the twin passions are good quality espressos and...scooters! So there are a couple of scooters nonchalantly parked next to the till, along with a smattering of Italian records thrown around for good measure. Played wrong, this could end up looking a little contrived, but this place really works. It helps that the coffee is sublime, easily on par with the Monmouth coffee company. It also helps that the staff have an authentic 50's Milanese coffee machine to work with. The menu is tiny, written on the back of a postcard. I ordered the hot chocolate which was like nothing I had drank before. It took about 5 minutes to make and then I drank it in 10 seconds. It is more like melted dark chocolate. I wanted to order the white chocolate with nutmeg, which apparently tastes like thick custard, but was told that this flavour had sold out, and when they sell out, someone has to go back to Italy to get the ingredients. I guess I will just have to hang around until they get it back in.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

5xnoPKjbQJd2MczxDsdQQg.text: On the way here, I walked on leake st and thought I would get shanked. Its a tunnel full of graffitti and artists works which was super cool but dodgy at the same time. Anyway, made my way here and the cafe gave a pirates of the carribean feel with red lights and a dark atmosphere,, so so cool!I had the hot chocolate mMmm so good. But i prefer hotel chocolate but supposedly they get theirs directly from Italy, a must try :)

KVkI-lM5scz4JRWQXv-lAQ.text: Considering I wanted to go to Scooterworks the first time I passed it, it took me a long time to get there.  Every tie I was going out with friends, I'd say, "Let's go to that scooter bar!"  I finally made it there last week and it was more awesome than the Beatles in their heyday... well...ok, that would be a tough battle, but Scooterworks is still amazing.Going to Scooterworks feels like stepping into Naples in the 1960's.  I think their front door is actually a portal in time.  My friend and I got cappuccinos and settled down at one of the only empty tables.  The drinks were perfectly foamy and delightfully delicious.  I loved the crowd - a laid back, artsy, diverse bunch, and I love the ambiance.  I think we'd all be hard pressed to find any other cafe that doubles as a Vespa good shop anywhere in the world.  (Or is it the other way around?)  The only downfall (if I may venture to even associate that word with this cafe/bar), is that they have no food there.  But this cannot abate their greatness - just know what to expect.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Coolest Cafe Ever
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. inside

oWQPs-ZGK_Q_XcNNzcpogA.text: Great little bar with a cosy atmosphere.  Board games downstairs and a friendly cat lazing around upstairs.

EZ1bunkNDp438EHHGEdOIQ.text: Awesome, is that cosy Cafe/Bar hidden beside Waterloo station offers you if not the best coffee in London by it's owner?kabar habib munzir terkini (liputan6.com/tag/habib-m…)

WlQ7_GSZX1Fn-nIvXnNyMA.text: Been here in the daytime and evening and it's always pretty busy, especially around lunchtime. Positives: Really friendly and warm service, cat that treats the entire cafe like his living room, excellent cocktails and lots of seating downstairs when it's a bit full up top.Downsides: Doesn't get a lot of light in the daytime, so it feels a bit like a cave on sunnier days, though there is a small outdoor section in the back. Not a lot of food selections, however they allow you to bring in outside food. Highly recommend hitting up the Lower Marsh lunchtime market for yummy food (Hungarian sausage wraps, Cuban sandwiches, Jamaican jerk chicken) and bringing it in. Last, not as laptop friendly as Four Corners across the way.Overall, nice spot to come for cocktails in the evening, especially when it's late (like after seeing a play in the nearby Old Vic) and the neighbourhood is quiet.

phtFRMMRHMjRptHCQG8mPg.text: Small cosy cafe. Friendly staff. Stay away from the hot chocolate. It is gooey and not pleasant. The baked cakes are ok.

vKL4No65-uIGkcdCbNRZ-A.text: It was my last night in London, and I'm so glad I decided to escape my hotel around 10:30pm  to walk to this place with a friend. Seriously, this was the highlight of my trip.  Forget Westminster Abbey and Buckingham Palace. This place has the BEST HOT CHOCOLATE.  It's so viscous, you need a spoon. I was quickly saddened because I knew that when I would return home I'd have to encounter the fraudulent watery substance Americans like to call hot chocolate -_-Cute vintage scooter decor, diverse crowd.  There was an individual fully decked out in a pirate's costume when I went.  This place also serves alcohol.  While I enjoyed my hot chocolate, my friend enjoyed a beer.  Would be great to go with friends.

lPrrBSI-pnEBS1CfrxtYkA.text: Yelp needs better information on this one. It is a very small bar only and does not serve food. Yelp contributors need to be more specific or someone has been gaming the system to drive traffic here.

5LUSew2MSEG2Tf2qqiYD9Q.text: Retro-trinkets, 1920s music, two cats and an English waitress quick to break into foreign accents and language. This is definitely my kinda place.The aspect I like most about ScooterCaffe was the gloriously escapist feel to it. The hint of this starts at the door: it's dimly lit inside, making it very difficult to see into the cafe from the outside. But enough is visible to stoke your curiosity. A Vespa scooter sits in the window with a cloth union jack flag draped over it. Next to it lie various faded bric-a-brac from yesteryear. Walking into the cafe reveals ScooterCaffe in its full retro glory. Rusty scooters against the walls. Tables covered in red and white checked table cloths. Walls plastered with old pictures and turn of the 20th century adverts. 1920s music playing in mono. So convincing was its effect that for a while, I felt like I'd wandered on to the set of a 1920s play.So, its retro-effect is pretty spell-binding. It's also got free wifi, a small space outside at the back and a large basement downstairs with more seating (though less retro-themed and more fairy lit). But a couple of things stop it from attaining 5 star status. The hot chocolate and brownie I had weren't exceptional, more edging towards the mediocre, which was disappointing given the stunning lead-up to them. If they can fix that (hint: source the brownies from market stall Galeto's. Job done. And look to French bakery Paul for pointers on how to make the best hot chocolate) then this place will be a shoe-in for 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. One of the scooters at ScooterCaffe
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Chocolat chaud and ginger & banana bread chez ScooterCaffe

_I8OQ6TlEidZnT1o6BXo0g.text: Went here around Christmas time last year and I tried the hot chocolate and brownie and they were the best I had ever tasted. As I was taking my first sip of chocolatey goodness, I looked over to see a lovely cat staring at me!

HepvB_fNfb9eE8CncToeVQ.text: I'm sitting at Scooter Caffe as I write this review, because it's my second time and I love it so much! I'm not sure if the coffee tops my favourite at Timberyard, but for a space to work with free wifi, a decent amount of power sockets, and a pretty relaxed atmosphere in the afternoon, it's great. And also has the resident cat so it balances out the not-as-good-as-Timberyard coffee.The first time I came here we ended up inadvertently sitting next to resident cat which was a great surprise! The girls who work here (as I've only seen women working here) are friendly and good at their jobs. The atmosphere is relaxed, with lots of strange stuff everywhere so cool space to look around. The music tends to be quite good and varied but not too loud which is great for both work and coffee-time chats. There's some outdoor space at the back as well which is good on sunny days, though I haven't been here during one of those rare London treats.It's taken me years to finally get myself to Scooter Caffe but now that I've been it's quickly becoming a favourite for relaxed afternoons getting work done and meeting up with friends. Give it a try!

S6g1aqp4xBptw3ecR3ZGjA.text: This is the most dive-y, badass business in London. So comfortable in its awesomeness that it exists in an area that is the antithesis of trendy - just outside the biggest commuter terminal in London. It's like the business owner asked himself, "Where should I open up a really cool cafe-cum-bar? Shoreditch? Hoxton? Fuck it. Waterloo."So you want:-Coffee in the morning?-Cocktails at night?-BYO food and free wifi any time?-A cup of tea in the evening when everyone else is drinking cocktails? No problem. Come to ScooterCaffè and own it, my friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Out back, enjoying a sunny day

k_BibkBkQg3pQ6ewZ7e1WA.text: This place has scooters! It is a cafe! If you're on the south bank, the BFI perhaps, tear yourself away from the tourist trap that it is and imagine you are in your very own Fellini film here at the Scooter Cafe. A cool artsy little cafe, with great espresso, but it'd be a real shame to grab a caffeine kick here and just knock one back and fly, instead have a Negroni, or two. Then enjoy the setting-at any time of day, if you need to do work, you could or you could kick back, forget whatever next is planned next get another Negroni, they are the best! N-E-G-R-O-N-I= yay! Worries, see ya! Deadlines, shmedlines. Oh and they also have cats. A dark and cosy spot, with a cute dingy little basement for after dark dalliances and more Negronis.

OYEX7NQeZCOLc50X5r1JLg.text: Lovely cafe with a resident cat!! The kitty is so adorable, and very friendly. The interior is retro/scooter themed, and supposedly Ethan Hawke is a regular here.Drinks are fine for the most part, though I didn't care at all for their French cider. Quite bad in fact. Fortunately petting the kitty makes up for it. If you're looking for a snack, grab a Wagon Wheel! Yum!

PrWMPNZpxYsUVYZGO5xIJw.text: Cosy and cramped is the Scooter Caffe on an icy cold day.  We sat along the wall under a low-hanging ceiling light (ouch!) near the staircase and adjacent banister upon which a sleeping cat was magically perched.The hot chocolate was almost eaten with a fork it was so dense.  Mmmmm.The latte was greedily and gratefully consumed.  (-coulda been less foamy and a bit warmer...)Tip: try to snag a chair that's not too low to the ground!  My friend was almost eye-level with our table! :D

HqnjZjY1ke_CCb7vMuPAQg.text: Coffee+Booze Bar (The best of both of both drugs. I mean worlds.)Locally baked cake Free wifi (but no computer camping) Free VHS movie nights And on a side note, cat! I'm a café cat. And I meow meow meow, I meow meow meow. Cat. I'm a café cat. And I dance dance dance, I dance dance dance. Now these are some backstreet boys I can get behind.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

lQ13PtjdlDZZLK3SD72TOg.text: A very Berlin feeling bar with a selection of good bottled beers (Erdinger and Sierra Nevada were my pick when I visited) and some fine cakes.The music is at a good level and well chosen, and there is plenty of seating throughout. If conversation lulls then there is plenty of interesting ephemera dotted around to spark another conversation.The resident cat is well fed, glossy coated,  and, most importantly, aloof as cats should be.My only gripe is the single unisex toilet which is always in use.

BrwNVutfyY9fm50Rgivn4A.text: This is a little place tucked away behind Waterloo Station. Upon first glance, it looks more like a little coffee shop where you can spend hours reading a book or writing your memoirs. And during the day, I wouldn't be surprised if that's exactly what it is.As night falls, it changes into a kitschy little bar with a full range of alcohols although I'd wager this is more for standard cocktails than any novel or innovative drinks due to the limited number of liqueurs and mixers. However, the drinks they do serve are impeccably made as evidenced by the very clean and crisp gin & tonics my friends ordered. I took a slightly different tack and ordered a double Laphroaig 10 year old whiskey neat. To my delight, and possibly the dismay of others, the smoky peaty smell spread over the whole bar hinting at a fresh bottle properly stored. Décor wise, it kind of looks like someone raided a storage locker clear out sale with items that are most likely described as "salvaged" or "reclaimed". It's not my style and thus unlikely that I would opt to come back (I prefer clean lines, stone, metal, and glass in my bars) but my sister loved it. Each to their own I suppose.Prices are very reasonable sot that is a draw but be warned - there is space for maybe 12-15 people to sit and very little standing room. So while good for meeting a friend or two, any medium to large group is going to be sorely disappointed. An interesting stop on our way to Cubana and probably best kept that way.

p2u8qPM3zVQ3jXd17rhBfg.text: Stopped in for coffee yesterday with a friend from out of town. We wanted a place with a bit of character and Scooter Caffe fit the bill. It's got a limited selection of food but we had some of their honey almond cake, which was deleicious. It's a bit dark inside during the day, but we loved the quirky decor, the music selection and petting the cat.

tAOFr-zOagP8-ZjVKHtfZQ.text: Such a cool Atmosphere at this little cafe. Very retro interior and the menu is a full bar along with endless coffee and pastry options. Everyone I came here with was looking for different things (a beer, a latte, a piece of cake, a soft drink) and they had it all! There is a back garden for when the weather is nicer and the ground floor is very pleasant with enough tables to find a place to sit with light. the basement seems more like a drinking atmosphere and much darker.  I did see the cat up on the chair at a nearby table but did not get to officially meet it. I guess ill just have to go back :)

7KeUBDdRgWxR0plKYiUlAA.text: If you allow animals in your establishment, there is a 99.9% chance that I will give it rave reviews! Highlights: - They have a cat! It lives there! When I was there the kitty was sitting on the staircase, just watching everyone come up and down, and going in and out of sleep.- A small cozy place with cool decorations - there are old scooters everywhere!- The cafe offers alcohol - simple cocktails - coffee, teas, and treats!- A good mix of people - hipsters, yuppies, middle-age, college kids, everyone! Lowlights:- The area that this is located in is currently under construction and the store front is blocked by construction fences, make it difficult to see / locate.Overall: A great place if you like exploring hole-in-the-wall places with a lot of character!

iUKKdlBEx31ak_bFsy4UVw.text: Don't tell anyone about this place. It's a step back to cafe 50-60's London Caffè style. Oh and Gin! Lovely

An0omYKfJDsgpjvLy-yXzw.text: Perhaps the best coffee shop-cum-bar in London, and made even better by the fact I live 10 mins' walk from it (excuse me a moment while I gloat).Okay, it's sort of hipsterish and frequented by people tapping on laptops and scribbling in Moleskines*  - and the chairs redefine 'threadbare' - but this is an excellent, excellent place tucked away on Lower Marsh. With two resident cats, a fully stocked bar, lush coffee, and a chilled, unpretentious vibe, Scootercaffe highlights exactly what is missing from most coffee shops in London: atmosphere.Tips:- don't order a flat white here; they don't serve it (they do, however, serve a hot chocolate which you could stand a spoon in).- wine is only £3.50 a glass- you are welcome to bring your own food although they serve a limited range of pastries- wifi is free; the password is stuck on the till- don't feed the kitties- do stroke the kitties (notice how I avoided the joke about stroking pussy...oh...wait)- the bathroom is frightening- watch your head on the light fittings- there's a patio out back* I may or may not be one of these people.

Pk-z2XultoItQwXY2mfqBA.text: Can't say much about this place because I didn't stay long but the setting was so cool. Also, I had never been to that area of town before and it seemed to have a bunch of interesting places. Will be going back to test again and come up with a more in-depth review.

piePf1Eai11oIsCvxaBRdQ.text: The best americano i've had in my life, and the baked goods are to die for. The cats are adorable, and the outside sitting area is so cozy. Overall, the whole cafe is very well decorated and has a great feel to it. Make sure to take a walk through the graffiti tunnel close by while you're in the area.

L3KNQSHahurZD7ujHoSE8g.text: My friend and I popped by here yesterday and I was delighted with the shabby chic interior and the rusting Vespa against the bar. A bit crowded but still pleasant and not overtly loud. A small selection of beers and just two wine options, red or white. But the white wine at least was wonderfully dry and the bartender- a bit surly- gave a proper pour which I appreciated. Aka filled the glass to the top! Sadly the cat is no longer there.

rT8dfP6UtmCv8w9Amj5FpQ.text: Horrible... I came inside and I was totally ignored. I sat and after 10 minutes none came to the table. I just packed my stuff and went out. Some people did the same after experiencing the total lack of customer service. Unbelievable

YDfMm3mx1SUobaw9XpRxbQ.text: Nice  enviornment in the evening and great relaxed cafe in the day. Coffee + cake are really good way to spend time in the afternoon, some of the best latte in the area. Tried the coffee martini in the evening and it was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Scooter cafe

y2qSYOc3kT7OvdJkSwk43Q.text: Whilst after a little caffeine kick whilst waiting for a meeting, I made the walk from my delicious Wahaca lunch, over to see the cat in the coffee shop due to my trusty friend yelp guiding my path. First of all, I must add, that I like coffee quite a lot. I do however, adore cats. In the crazy cat lady way. So you could imagine my excitement whilst scouring yelp and finding this little gem. Anyway, I arrived and was greeted by two uber cool hipster ladies behind the counter who ushered me in to take a seat. They were really friendly and quickly took my order. I tried not to look too insane but immediately my cat-detector vision was reporting negative to felines in any proximity. As if to add insult to injury my coffee arrived and my latte art was a swirly blob. But the whole experience was saved, by the coffee being nice (not on par with others in London but certainly nice) and I found the furry friend. The Kitty was all snuggled on a chair downstairs (that I didn't know existed until I needed the loo), so I got to have a little tlc time with the cat which certainly made my day. Next time, I'll be back, but next time I'm bringing whiskas!

Q3Z49sN5cIP2wBlowxSlWw.text: Any establishment that serves a decent cup of coffee and owns a cat gets 5-stars from me. But seriously, Scooter Caffe is the quirkiest little coffee shop I've ever set foot on. They have great coffee I'm told but I only tried tea here and spent an afternoon talking to my friend and playing with their resident cat -- who is super cute, btw.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. My favourite thing about this place. 3

IHvP6AtfZPDdbk9kI9cxbw.text: Yes, there is a lazy cat walking around, but the cafe is interesting enough by itself.I love the casual ambiance, I think it attracts friendlier people. What's good :- Free wifi.- They allow you to bring in outside food. - There's a cute cat walking like he owns the place.- Drinks and cocktails. What's not: - The placing is not the proper one for a cafe like this. The decor is just my type: relaxing, vintage and rustic.It has great vibes, pleasing and relaxing atmosphere and the loveliest staff. It is perfect for some 'me time'.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

F5DSZTxjGzya_4_M5_z-og.text: Hearing there was a resident cat sold the deal for me when I found this place on Yelp.We had time to kill before checking into our hotel and fancied a coffee, so nipped in here for our caffeine fix. It ended up with just me having a coffee and somehow managed to pick the table where the cat was fast asleep on a chair next to. Not deliberate, honest!Unfortunately, the milk in my coffee had taken a turn for the worst. Immediately realised it was sour. Took the coffee back up to the girl who served me, she apologised and said there had been problems with the milk before. She happily swapped the coffee for a lovely, refreshing Fentimans lemonade. The decor is scooter and vintage themed, very cool. They have a small terrace area at the back that looks like a little sun trap too. Lots of delicious looking cakes on the counter too.I would go back if I was in London, hope they can get the sour milk situation straightened out, it's a cool wee place. Passed it later on that night and it was buzzing with folk drinking inside and out.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Snoozing kitty

0R42H2b7NTamY6QEgZOcWQ.text: This is a quirky little café that roasts their own beans. They offer cake with your coffee, but sadly no meals. You can bring in something from the markets nearby to eat with your coffee though, so that's cool. Plenty of Cuban music playing while I was there. Didn't see the cat though

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Quirky

HuQwaxPMrSgpkSRlsAsD3Q.text: Very friendly staff. Cat is charming, too.Espresso is very good. They have a proper arm press machine from the 70's (educated guess). The roast themselves and sell it. They do functions, too. I had my take-in lunch there and that's fine. The owner knows a thing or two about scooters.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Venetian painting actually blends in well with the colours of the cafe
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Amazing sweets
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Cool interior

4Q7pcSWbY8lJyciknBxeOA.text: I can't add much more to the chorus here, only to say this place is an awesome and rare blend of charm, service and quirk that you can't help but smile and love it.And the manager is a cat.  That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

mViQ3ppLRNrmXwVJtZdSzg.text: Visited here today and it's quirky and unique in a very good and refreshing way, the coffee was excellent and the staff were friendly.This place needs to be visited to be appreciated , it's a gem in a sea of ordinary bland coffee establishments and it will probably not be to everyone's taste but without trying the Scooter Cafe how can you have an opinion. Unique,cosy,quirky,chilled,interesting, a must visit!!

o5PgAOy65xQhEWjMexod4A.text: Scooter shop by day, cool bar/cafe even comedy venue by night. Love this place it really has a uniqueness about it because it turns from one to another yet keeping elements of the bike shop within it. Good coffee but I usually come here for a beer or wine. Quirky chairs it's a cool place to stop off at if in area.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Love the interior here.
Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom

My4tyd7QylNgKmY_4m6qtg.text: Came for the cat, stayed for a chat!In all seriousness, I visited the London Eye recently with some friends, and we decided to stop here afterwards once I told them that it had a resident cat (sorta like a cat cafe). I ordered a coffee while my friends both ordered tea, and we sat downstairs. We honestly lost track of time in the cafe, as the environment and vibe were really quite nice. Something in between hipster and comfortable. Really enjoyed this place and the coffee/tea were quite good, but not spectacular. Unfortunately the kitty was asleep during the time I was there, but seemed quite friendly. One of the finds on Yelp that I am most proud of. Definitely coming back if in the neighborhood.

JqJh8IlX6gfp1BJFYKqSRw.text: Awesome coffee at the day and marvelous bar for some beer or whiskey at the evening.I totally enjoy the vibe any time I'm there (usually after 7pm).Lovely place, great atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. I love this place

fkZiaGvyeG2s9HcXOsEuLA.text: Studying at scooter caffe isn't ideal due to the dim lighting, but the coffee here is fantastic! Not to mention also the cheapest along the lower marsh. A great place to check out, you should definitely visit for the funky decor, endlessly tasteful and fantastic playlist of jazz music, and of course, for the adorable cat (who seems to be always sleeping). Will always pick this place to introduce to friends who think the lower marsh isn't cool enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Cafe latte. Nice coffee. On the lighter side.

ZaAQ_gIroK8ezqPmxxMqbQ.text: We stopped in for a coffee on an unexpectedly rainy day and it was a lovely comfortable place to wait out the rain. The staff were friendly and efficient and served us quickly despite how busy it was when we arrived.  It is very kitschy inside in a way that doesn't feel too forced. There isn't much in the way of food but the coffee was pretty good!   It's quite small but has alcoholic options too so can take care of you from noon till night.

Kp0wbueHuKM1pEkbA4NMpg.text: Lovely cafe with both outdoor and basement seating. The latter looked a little cozy, a little shady. There was a cute, sleepy cat guarding the bathroom in the basement as well as kitschy furniture decorating the place. I got a cider there, surprisingly a French cider, but it seems they have good coffee and cocktails as well. The beer selection didn't look promising at all, unfortunately. There's free wifi as well as a clean bathroom, so it's a nice place to stop by when you're tired. I saw quite a few people there alone, either reading or using their laptops, so you won't feel out of place if you do the same.

jyWQV1HJh3f4Gp6E7EJWcQ.text: Okay coffee in a scooter themed cafe. I liked the decor, but I expected more from this place. It was listed in a friend's book as having some of the best coffee in London. Definitely not! The tables were cute, I guess, but not very functional. The loo is down a spiral staircase, with a broken railing, so be warned! This cafe is also famed for its resident cat, but even the cat was unfriendly. Disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Scooter Caffe - London, United Kingdom. Cool decor

1MdhhPD84_bWZJgzWK2JdA.text: The coffee and pastries are awesome here. The place is hard to find since it only say bar on top. There is a beatup vespa in the window. Seating is a little tight but still worth it.
